review: Angie was a boss. She was super attentive and way above the service level I'd expect from a chain like this. Food was spot on and diligent about my girlfriend allergies. Would definitely come back except for the fact it's a break from my healthier norm.

Have eaten here many times before but I was really disappointed with my last visit. It was just my mom and I and the service was very poor. We were actually handed our check before we were even half way done eating! What if we had wanted dessert? Guess they really didn't want us to stay. I'm giving it two stars because despite everything else the food was quite tasty.

If you want to be stared at by a horde of "Children of the Damned" hostesses and not be greeted/seated/etc, then walk into this restaurant. Completely mediocre food, took an act of god to get a straw from the waitress, and she brought the check as soon as I received my meal. Service was awful, food was mildly edible, and the "friendly staff" was anything but. I would highly recommend ANYWHERE else in Reno if you want a burger.
the burgers are not bad the fries are really dry.and the waiter messes up the drinks you ordered.

I was worried about this Red Robin for awhile, the couple of times I've gone in during the last year, it's been a ghost town!  Today, however, the parking lot was completely full and it was very busy inside.  The service was GREAT today, all the waiters seemed to work together to make sure our drinks were never empty, and our server was friendly, but not overly so.  The food is consistent, and in that I mean, it's just fine.  Just like any Starbucks or good chain anywhere, you know what you are going to get, and you know you're going to enjoy it.  For the sake of the great people who gave great service today, (and..okay, fine.. for the sake of my steak fry craving), I hope this Red Robin is always as busy as it was today.

My burger was okay - I've had better at many other places. And for some reason, the hostess decided to seat us in the kid section instead of a quieter section by the bar. We were surrounded by tables of screaming and hyperactive children. One kid was jumping up and down on his seat.  Now, I'm a fan of kids, but when I go out to eat I'd rather be seated in the adult section. Just sayin'.

Just a normal red robin nothing special but reliable. They only thing that I would not reccomend is the tower of oniion rings as they tasted really salty when we went last. Servers were nice to us other than what the other reviews have stated.  Red Robin.....yummmm or in most cases okayyyy.

In all our travels, this was the first time we saw a Red Robin! We just had to try it!  We were pleasantly surprised to have the door opened for us as we walked up.  Took awhile since we were taking pictures.....  Waitress was very helpful when she found out it was our first time there....very patient, too!  We ordered an appetizer of onion rings and calamari and it came in a neat cone holder with sauces.  We were happy with them since we've had some pretty terrible examples of both onion rings and calamari!  We only ordered 1 burger because we were still a little full from breakfast so we tried the BBQ burger.  Had to find the waitress since I forgot to tell my husband that I wanted sweet potato fries not steak fries....it was no problem and no hassles.  When we got my order, the waitress brought it to us in separate trays which was surprising because a lot of restaurants frown when I explain that he has to help me.... Great service, great food! Will look for more Red Robins elsewhere!

This is one place I can make a meal last for two!  Looooove their bottomless steak fries!  I really should lay off the starch.  Lol.  I always get a burger, eat 1/3 of it, and ask for the continuous bottomless stead fries.  And don't forget the freckled lemonade on the side.  Gotta have that.  Boss gave me $50 worth of gift cards to RR for xmas....time to pig out!
So-so. I only order the whiskey chicken era. The rest of the food is less than desirable. Plus this is a "nice night out" place for Sun valley. Just be weary of that

Completely unimpressed.  The waiter who took our order was in a rush to get away from our table.  Drinks never got refilled, neither did the supposedly bottomless fries.  Never coming back here again.

I don't know if my experience was tainted by the annoying/rude hostess  but jeez would it kill you to crack a smile at customers as they come in instead of rolling your eyes at them as soon as they come inside. Sorry for wanting to eat at your restaurant.  So from the get go, I did not feel welcome. To add to that, As one other reviewer said, something about the feug shui is off about his place that is just not welcoming. Anyways, the rest of the staff was great.  The food was salty but decent. The burger tasted okay but I felt my dining partner makes a much better burger at home. The mint shake was good but not worth getting again. Steak Fries, again just okay.  Wings were fine and my chilli wasn't good but I was hungry so I ate it.  The food just wasn't up to par and this would be 3 stars if  wasn't for the rude hostess and the layout of the place.  I probably won't be back.

April 21, 2013 Sunday - dinner 5:30 PM 2 adults  Atmosphere - 4 stars Food - 4 stars Service - 4 stars Background - Planning on going to Paulie's Pizza but when we got there they were closed, it is Sunday thing.  Been years since I had been here so we thought we give it a try today. Atmosphere - Construction is going on outside in the parking lot, looks like a new large sign will be put up soon. Just a comment on what I saw from the outside and not affecting my grading of the atmosphere inside.  Like I said it has been years and looks they have tried to update the place but not really much has changed.  Still has that out dated feel.   Food   Appetizer - We had an order of small fries.  Nothing special but the dipping sauces where a nice touch.   My Main Course - They had a special little menu card with the five alarm burger coming back, which is what I typically order.  My wife actually looked at the menu and suggested to be the Burnin' Love burger.  I went with it.  The fried jalapeno slices were peppery heaven, nice heat and crunch.  I could just eat those.  Everything is better fried or with bacon.   Dessert - Full. Service - Just there.   Future - Sure, maybe it is time to try the Spark's location next.

Holy crap - my mind is blown!  My husband and I ate here several years ago and we both had cheeseburgers...I can't remember the name of the one I had, but I remember I hated the special sauce and/or sweet relish that was all over my burger.  I vowed to never return.  Then 3 years later, we decide to go ahead and try it out again.  Since I didn't want to have the same burger experience, I tried the Arctic Cod Fish and Chips instead...and now I'm *IN LOVE*!!  We seriously go here every other weekend, if not every weekend, just so I can have the hand-battered fish with their super yummy dilled tartar sauce.  The fish always arrives super hot, perfectly battered, and always flaky.  And I don't know how they make that tartar sauce so damn great, but it's just perfect, and is probably what makes the meal the best tasting thing ever.  I also ask for extra lemons so I can add a little lemon juice on top of each one.  THIS IS HEAVEN, no joke!  My hubby tries something new every time.  Their menu is huge and he's liked everything he's had so far, but I'll be sticking with my fish.....ah, *drool*

I effing love the Burning Love burger!!!  And the fries are always good (and plenty with the bottomless fry gig).  The team working is nice and mostly attentive.  The place is clean and the service is fast.   So, while I have been here a handful of times, it has always been consistent.  It's not a Ruth's Chris, but its a damn fine place to go sit and have a burger.
Seriously, though.......Red Robin DEFINES what a GREAT burger should be!! Additionally, the "bottomless fries" and the every so great onion rings make Red Robin a class act!!!!!! Good value, too!!

We waited for a while before anyone came to take our drink order. When the waiter did come he had sweat dripping down his face. My glass was empty for quite some time and when he asked if I wanted a refill even though I still had half my food left so of course. It took again quite some time for him to bring it. There was a girl who kept asking for her orders to be just ignored. She complained about it. Then before we left she finally said she had been asking for her order for over 5 minutes and has been ignored. She asked the guys who were talking away if the could stop talking for a minute and help her to be told few minutes later that she was basically wrong for doing that and to be quiet. She was the only one who sounded to be working. Poor girl. Sounds like poor management to me.

Absolutely horrible service. We dined at Red Robin last week and it is up there with the worst service ever. Our waiter had 2 other tables...not busy at all. He took our drink order and it took at least 15 minutes to even get water as well as what we ordered. We ended up going to the servers station ourselves to get water. After the food came out our server knew we were clearly unhappy and avoided us like the plague. He would shout from 10 feet away as he was walking "everything good?"'. He never refilled our drinks so again we headed to the soda machine ourselves. The food was awful. I told him I was gluten free so I took my salad with no croutons and there was bread sitting on it when it came out. But he never came up to the table to ask so i just picked around it. Not a fan of Red Robin and we will never be back.

All I can say is that their food is always the best.  Their jalapeño medallions are delicious.  Clucks and fries are delicious and anytime a meal has fries, they are served as bottomless fries.  You can always ask for more.  My family and I love going here for a quick meal.  The staff is always friendly and they always give a balloon to the kids.  I would highly recommend this place as a great place to eat.  Always.

We don't go to Red Robin often as they have a somewhat limited menu (I think anyway).  I know they are a burger place but not everyone in my family likes to get burgers while we are all out.  What they do have has always been good.  The hubby and I actually went to lunch today by ourselves (imagine that??  lol).   We had Mark as our waiter and he was awesome.  He checked on us regularly and was very pleasant.  He seemed to enjoy his job of dealing with people (or was a great actor??).  The manager ( I didn't get his name) was even walking around making sure everyone was doing ok....it was nice to see that.   For me the staff is hot or cold.  Some are good and pay attention to their jobs and some you want to tell them just go sit down and let me take care of it.   For the most part we have had good service here and it's actually been quiet a while since we have had bad service.   Now onto the food.  I usually get the Crispy Chicken Tender Salad and it is really good.   I like it with Ranch dressing.   Today though I actually went out of the normal....the husband was impressed :P.   I got a burger which is even a bigger surprise since I very rarely order a burger when we go out.  The only other places I have ordered a burger is Fudruckers and Legends Bar and Grill.   The burger was good.  I like my burger killed (as the hubby calls it...lol) I have to have it cooked all the way through...no pink.   I made my own burger with mayo, lettuce, tomatoes, jalapenos, and a sesame bun.  I loved that they had all the items listed so I could exactly what I wanted on my burger.  It was really good.  I may actually get another one next time we go there.  I liked that the jalapenos seemed fresh and crisp.  They looked like they were freshly cut as they were not uniform size...some a little thicker and some a little thinner.  I liked that.  I also liked that put them evenly across the bottom bun so I had a bit of jalapeno with every bite instead of one bite nothing and the next bite a mouthful of jalapeno.  The hubby got the mushroom burger and enjoyed it.   I have to say the only thing I don't like about this Red Robin is the seating that is by the window closest to parking lot.  The tables feel to close together.  I feel like I am having lunch at the same table with people I don't know.  Of course when I stand up to leave they get to know me pretty well since my butt ends up really close to them with the little space between the tables.  I am 5'9 1/2" and 128 lbs so if I feel like there is no room it's got to be bad...lol.   Of course there is an easy way to avoid sitting at these tables just by asking.

This is my first choice when I think about burgers. They have really good menu serving tasty and juicy burgers. With so many choices for the add-on items, the uncapped fries and the red robin sauce, this place is a go-go! As a person who is just starting to taste red meat, I love this place.
Good burgers with fast and friendly service.

I don't typically frequent chains but a man I met in Lowe's gave me a royalty card when I told him it was my birthday a couple days prior (gotta love the friendliness of random people in town).  I came here alone during my lunch break for the free birthday burger. I had a veggie burger with mushrooms and Swiss. The burger itself was very good and the fries were good too. Food was excellent for a diner.  Why -2 then? The waitress (and actually all the female servers) looked tired, bored, and indifferent to customers. When I came in, she said my card hadn't been processed yet (I registered hours earlier). I said I can show her my ID and she said she couldn't get me my free food that way. I asked her to speak to the manager. I didn't meet the manager but I saw him from the distance. He was nice enough to give me the free burger and fries. (If you are a RR employee, I can assure you I won't be an asshole and go back to get another free burger once my card is active. I'm not that low).  Because I was the dreaded party of 1, my waitress only came back to do a quick "How is everything?", and to drop off the check. No refill on the famous bottomless fries for me =(
Great food. Great atmosphere. Friendly service. Bottomless fries. What more can one ask for.

Ordered a burger with cheese, tomatoes and grilled onion. Got a burger with cheese and lettuce. Didn't realize it was wrong until I got home so not sure if they will correct it if you dine in. The fries are good and I was told the grilled cheese was "great" but overall not impressed. Can get a better burger for less money elsewhere.

God only knows why I keep ending up in these franchised restaurants lately. I mean, they're not that amazing and they're the same 'ole, same 'ole everywhere you go. But I keep getting dragged to these restaurants because it's the most comforting place to go for my friends and family rather than take a step out on a ledge and see where the experience goes. So, foreword that's not really necessary but completed, I ended up at Red Robin. SIGH. So typical.  I've had one of their burgers before and it was good but I'm not much of a burger kind of girl. So yeah, I gobbled it down without really whimpering, and the bottomless fries were a nice touch, but was I amazed and potbellied-pleased? NO. I was bored. My visit this time around was the same thing. No really interesting dishes to try and nothing really stand alone amazing. So I had the Chicken-Tortilla soup. Wahoo. Just not taste-bud explosion amazing. (I admit this is a lot to ask of a Red Robin, but still.) The fries were hot and soft, but definitely not my favorite fries (I mean, we all have our favorite place for fries, right?). So, okay food, but not a place I enjoy going back to more than once. And as far as the service goes, OH NO. Our waitress was so dismissive and it was kind of hurtful (if I really got hurt that easily). She literally gave us our check the moment I finished my soup and without asking if we needed or wanted anything else. So clearly I did not, in fact, want dessert. Thank you, chick! But whatever, it's not like I was planning to be a faithful customer or anything.

Consistently delicious. I love that they will make any kind of burger for you and they use Boca for their veggie burgers. If that's not enough for you they have bottomless fries, refills on your drink and endless mac and cheese for the kids if thats what they order.

February 7th at approximately 1 o'clock we decided to wonder into our local Red Robin.  Seated within seconds and promptly greeted by our waitress Kourtney, the experience was off to a good start.   I had the royal burger and my wife had the whiskey bbq burger.  Foods was good and service was precise.   Thanks Kourtney for great service

My husband brought me lunch the other day,  bbq chicken wrap with fries and it was super delicious. Shout out to Cornelius for making sure the order was just perfect. One of our favorite places, definitely a top notch burger joint. Thanks. ..Jenn & Simon

Jonas is the best server ever! He is very attentive and takes care of his guests. We went tonight and they were quite busy. He brought us fries before our food because it was taking a bit longer than normal. One of our children didn't get her food so he made sure that her food was going and brought it right away. He brought new drinks at the appropriate time and even asked how many boxes we needed when it came time for us to go. When I get ready to go back, I am going to make sure that he is working!! Great job Jonas, thank you again.

I don't often go to Red Robin as I feel like their food is no different from other places that are similar.  However, it's one of my sister's favorites and my mother-in-laws favorite.  I end up here a lot when I have dinner with them.  They have a pretty extensive menu of "gourmet" burgers, chicken sandwiches, salads, and other entrees (fish tacos, chicken fingers, etc.).  Every time I've gone, they wait staff has always been extremely nice and everything comes out quickly.  I think our food came out less than 15 minutes after we ordered the other night.  I am a fan, however, of their cheesesticks.  They are some of the best that I've had around town. Overall, Red Robin isn't my first place to go.  However, I'm not usually disappointed when I leave.

This place is good for quick food. The service is hit or miss, depending on the servers mood. Usually the good comes out quick and fresh. They are good with big groups. I come here because they have the option to change out any burger with a Boca party for the vegetarians. You can also add an egg to any burger, it's delicious!

I don't go to Red Robins very often, but we stopped here for dinner during our road trip. Their menu contains wide variety of selections to choose from, starting from their burgers, sandwiches, salads, and other entrees. They have bottomless fries too!The staff was very nice and helpful, and food was delicious!

We been here a few time and its an alright eatery. I do like the bottomless fries, and refills on are drinks. And the desserts are good. I do give an extra star, do to the fact that we can bring are pugs to the outside patio and they can eat with us. That's just right. So overall, we do like the coming here and having a burger and fries and some hot wings. So it's all good.

Can the girls at the door at least pretend that they are working instead of twirling their messy hair and looking at their fingernails. Oh and looking at the air aimlessly. if they were trying not to look ditzy, they are failing miserably. Maybe open the door for the customers coming in could be an option. Ugly attitude at the door kill it for me. please take a lesson in customer service 101. please!!. Thanks. waiter was great. food. average.  wish employees were more engaged. if not, go home. please. Ate here saturday, june 21.

It has been a while since I've visited the Red Robin Gourmet Burgers here in Reno, Nevada, and when I entered, I realized that not much had changed. I've always had pleasant experiences at this Red Robin establishment as there has always been someone to greet me and my party at the door and the hosts have always been quick to seat us. Today, I was meeting up with some co-workers for a celebratory lunch. The first thing I noticed after sitting down and ordering my drink was that the menu IS new. The menus have been redone in a harder laminate packaging that protects the menu much more efficiently than the older packaging. I asked for a raspberry lemonade that the waiter said wasn't on the menu but that he'd gladly get for me. I'm not sure how true that was as it was completed quite fast, but eh, I enjoyed it. So my co-workers and I spoke for a little while as we waited for our order. I chose the crispy chicken sandwich today as anything chicken is pretty effin' fantastic to me. I was debating between that, a teriyaki chicken sandwich, and a BBQ chicken sandwich, but decided I'd play it safe. I asked for the crispy chicken sandwich with lettuce and tomato only, as I am very picky about my condiments. The waiter returned many times to fill our drinks. Once the order arrived, I was a little disappointed that the fries were packaged in a much smaller container than their previous, carefree splatter across the basket with the sandwich. But of course, the food was delicious. The chicken sandwich was tender and juicy as chicken sandwiches are meant to be, but not always prepared at other restaurants. The lettuce tasted fresh and the bread was of course FABULOUS. The tomato was oddly missing, but I figured I could live without it. In the meantime, I'd also asked for a side of marinara sauce for my fries (sometimes people look at me funny for asking for that, but this waiter simply paused a second before obliging). The fries were as great as I remembered and oddly enough I didn't need to take advantage of the bottomless fries as I had in the past! The waiter promptly delivered the bill and gave us another refill (yes!) before we left for the afternoon. Red Robin Gourmet Burgers continues to be the pleasant, family-friendly restaurant that I'd remembered. Speaking of, they were starting to get REALLY busy with plenty of families entering the establishment for lunch. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for a good old-fashioned sandwich for any occasion.

Poor sound dampening in this place--bus boys shouting, music blaring at the bar, noisy customers.  Took 20 minutes to get a "never ending" plate of fries--I guess they figure if they take long enough, you will give up and leave the premises.  Also, the bill was figured incorrectly.  The burger had too much wet condiment component for the soft bun--should be on a sturdy onion bun.  A disappointment.

Always my go-to stop for a great Burger and a gorge-fest of Steak Fries, it cannot be beat.  For those into healthier options, you can get some veg instead of fries or Sweet Potato fries now too.  Huge selection of burgers.  Take a few minutes to read the menu and if none stand out, do the 'make your own'.   Personal favorites are the Whiskey River BBQ burger and Royal Red Robin.  They got the burger cooked properly this time but even when overcooked, they are still juicy and tasty. Went for the special they had yesterday, $5 off when you spend $10 or more in celebration of their 500th Restaurant for Royalty Rewards members.  Corporate needs to prep their restaurants better:  At least 3 of the lower-level staff said they had no advance warning on this promo and they were hammered.  I had an early dinner around 4pm and they were still in clean-up mode from lunch.  Let your franchises know about such promos so they can schedule appropriately!  I can only imagine how frustrated some customers may have been during that rush and any review written about a visit yesterday needs to take that into consideration.  There have been previous e-mail promos that did not get to the staff at the restaurant, so there's clearly a breakdown in communication somewhere. Staff have always been friendly and attentive.  Managers often stop by to see how the food and service is.  I try to go once a month but it has been a few months since my last visit.  I forgot his name but a bartender/server still recognized me and asked how I was doing even though he was busy and just passing by the table I was at. The Red Robin spice blend is sometimes overused on fries so if you are one that prefers mild seasoning, be sure to request no seasoning on your fries.  There's always a container at the table so you can season them yourself. If you enjoy burgers and even go once in a blue moon, be sure to sign up for their Royalty Reward program.  Unlike most other places that only offer free food on your birthday, you have an entire month to redeem your free birthday burger! (not to mention the previously mentioned promotion yesterday that was awesome) This is a Burger Diner . . . it's going to be noisy!  This is NOT a place for an intimate, elegant dinner.  There's an arcade just inside the entrance for cryin' out loud! The decor is nostalgic and modern with classic pop culture posters and historical ones.  TVs are viewable from nearly every seat in the restaurant, depends on how good your eye-sight is from some of the fringe seats.

I was pleasantly surprised how great lunch was when I went here last Saturday. My past experiences at Red Robin were hit and miss. I thought the food was good, especially the $3 wedge salad. The Can-Crafted Cocktails were super yummy, I even tried to recreate the Wildbeery one at home! Everything was priced well, service was nice, and all the employees were pleasant.

The burgers and fries were great. Problem? No drink or fries refills. When we asked for a drink to go, we were given an empty cup. Really? I asked if refills were free and the waitress then asked if we wanted a fresh drink in the go cup. Otherwise, it was a good meal.
Reno has a lot of top notch burgers. A franchise has to work hard to compete; Red Robin does that and more. Lots of options, consistent food; good shakes.

On this visit everything was lukewarm. The chicken tortilla soup was lukewarm so we sent it back. They brought a new one out and it was lukewarm. Our gourmet burger was lukewarm. The fries were lukewarm. They said they would bring out new fries and it took them forever. And they didn't offer ketchup or ranch dressing for the fries. The only thing that wasn't lukewarm was the water and it was ice cold. If you like hot food, make sure you let them know it needs to be hot or maybe just avoid this place. Never really on their game tonight.. ***Update*** we returned to give them another try a few months later and we're glad to say that all was better. Food was adequately hot and service was good. They're still hesitant to dish out there "bottomless" fries but they will bring out new rounds if you have the patience. So, 3.5 stars now.

Service both times was ok. Food was good but we had to wait for a good 15 minutes when we ran out of water and the waitress forgot to bring my girlfriends ranch for her fries. They didn't check on us nearly enough we went for lunch both times and they weren't busy. I will go back but only because the foods good.

Red Robin has always offered me a good meal at a slightly upscale price. Is it worth it? Yes! Absolutely! The staff is always prompt and polite. Very personable. Service is great! The flavors are rich. Every burger I have had is juicy and tangy. I love their Royal Red Robin that is topped with bacon and an egg! The shakes are luxuriously sweet.  They are pricey. Not pricey as in 1-percenter pricey but bringing a family here on a regular basis can drive a working man to bankruptcy before the cholesterol kills you. So, I take off one star for that alone.

I visited this Red Robin on 10-4-2014 around normal lunchtime. It was not that busy but food took quite some time. The other person I was with ordered a gluten free bun for his burger, I had a regular bun- which is ok for me. However the fries came out old and cold and limp- though they happily remade new ones....hence the 2nd star. Both burgers were not very hot either, but tasted decent. The water served was nasty tasting, worse than tap water. Unclean bar guns? Gross. After the meal we both had sick stomachs and bad stomach air pressure lol. Then the GF person got so lightheaded and dizzy we had to go home and get the emergency gluten enzyme pills for when gluten is in a supposedly GF meal. My curiosity is: is Red Robin using MSG in their beef? Anyway won't go back. That's why I go to local places like midtown eats or Grate Full Gardens because we actually feel good after a meal there. Just because it says GF doesn't make it so!

Went with family on Sunday night for dinner, thinking it would be fast.   When you go with kids you don't want to wait 45mins for burgers.. Service was the awful....    Ordered,  drinks and mozzarella sticks as appetizers to hold the kids over until their dinner came. . We got our drinks and appetizers on a timely manner,  but we all (Party of 6) didn't have napkins or silverware  through the appetizers.  We had to ASK for them when all the sticks where gone and with my two nephews, they needed the napkins...    45 mins. later we got our dinner, which it seems long to me for a burger restaurant.  We needed a few take home boxes, and while we waited to ask for the check and doggy box we noticed a few of the staff upset about who had what tables.  Not professional at all to see the staff arguing among each other..  The manager was at many tables that night apologizing.  They were clearly having a VERY VERY bad night... I'll try them again in time, hopping they get their issues worked out.

My husband and I decided to have dinner here the other night because he had a gift card and he has never been to a Red Robin.  As soon as we walked in a host named Zoe asked how many so she could seat us...she was extremely rude and acted like she did not care about us at all. But then we sat down and our waitress came over named Amber! She was excellent!  She definitely went above and beyond for us! I had the bbq chicken sandwich with fries. my meal was delicious!  My husband had the double cheeseburger and fries...he loved it! But the best of all was the Blue Moon milkshake. It was amazing!!! So I will definitely be going back because of Amber, the food and the atmosphere. Loved it! Very disappointed in the host Zoe!

I wish I could choose no stars. This seriously was the worst service. Waited 2 hours for food, and just decides to leave. Not worth waiting for a burger. The staff did not seem to care at all. Won't be returning.

Red robin is extremely kids friendly. The food is really good and the waiters/waitresses are very professional. We even had the visit of the manager to make sure everything was great. I certainly will go back. As well, in the Summer, I love to eat outside on their patio.

Sat at the bar cause it was pretty busy and we didn't want to wait. When we got there we were the only ones but took the bartender a bit to get to us. Service was a little slow. They forgot to bring us our appetizer even though it was just chips and dip. When we got the food it wasn't very hot. The bartender didn't refill our waters at all. Besides all that the chicken burger and fries were alright. There's to many amazing places to eat in Reno so we probably won't be coming back to this one.... Claim Jumpers is just down the street.

I'm not a corporate chain food fan at all but my daughter chose this place, mostly because she likes to say "Red Robin, Yum.." As for the taste of the food I'd actually give it 4 stars which I would never do for a chain restaurant. I had the southwest salad, it had fried picked jalapeños which were "yum" and my daughter loves the freckled lemonade. I also appreciate the fruit & veggie side choices for the kids, not just fries. 3 stars is because the service was mediocre at best. (And it's a corporate chain restaurant, honestly) Server was slow, when the food got dropped off I asked for the check and a box explaining we had an appointment to get to. He dropped them off and never came back. I had to flag down someone else to run my card. All and all not a horrible experience which I was expecting.

Do not get the turkey burger!! I am recovering from the worst food poisoning of my life.  The tables are old and sticky.  The carpet is disgusting and the food is not that great.  Our waitress was very nice but unfortunately her kitchen is serving spoiled food.

This particular Red Robin does not seem to take Gluten Intolerance very seriously. I have been there twice and both times I have had to really stress the importance, because they do not take all of the precautions/steps that many other Red Robins do. They honestly were like, "Ya, ya..." The second time I was there my friend said something like about having an epi pen with her and all of a sudden the waiter visibly started taking it more seriously as I ordered. They still did not do all of the steps when my food came out (like different colored basket and manager bringing it out like others do) and a different waiter said, "Oh ya, that is a gluten free bun...." and something like if I asked for the GF dedicated fries then that's what those are. ~ I didn't get sick, fortunately that time, but I did after the first time. The ONLY reason why I went there the second time was because of a big get-together. ~ I HIGHLY recommend the Red Robin in Spanish Springs, though. They are totally on top of gluten issues and take all of the steps. If there is ANY question, they remake whatever it is. I have never questioned it there, but several times (I go there all the time) a manager has brought me part of my food and apologized for the delay on the other part (usually the fries), because they could not personally guarantee there was no cross-contamination (etc) of my particular item so they are having them remade. HUGE difference in service and reliability.  ~  I gave it 3 stars, because the food tastes really good like any other Red Robin. If you do not have any food allergies, then there is no problem going here.
The food is always good, the service is usually great and the menu is interesting. I will eat here again, you know, when I want a burger.

Lured by the idea of limitless steak fries, I asked for the burger with mushrooms and wanted provolone with it. The server said most burgers were cooked as medium, with a bit of pink on it, unless requested otherwise. Sounded perfect.  Burger arrived with a small serving of the steak fries, lightly done (also my personal request).  Fries were quite good, not overly salty and done the way I requested. The burger was another story. Hard as a hockey puck on the outside with one side clearly blackened.  I waited for awhile to get the server's attention regarding the burger. When I pointed how overcooked the burger was, she just shrugged and said, "I'll let the kitchen know." No offer to get another one made - silly me - I just assumed she was going to do it. Another few minutes pass but I'M HUNGRY, so I ate half of the burger in front of me, but no other burger ever made its way to my table. I finally asked for the manager, who clearly agreed that the burger was overdone and apologetic. It was just too late to take her up on her offer to have another burger made for me, so she very nicely comped the meal - that's the only reason I'm giving this place anything other than one star.
Am a red robin fan n the food here has the same standard. I usually eat whiskey river bbq chicken, cant find anything  wrong with it. Friendly staff. Good service

We haven't been here in a while. I was a little disappointed. Burgers weren't as good as before. The black and blue was 15.00 wow that is quite a bit more than before. All others were 10.00. Good food but not worth the 70.00 we paid. We used to get out of here for 40.00 for the four of us. Corprate stores giving you less for your money.  Quality down, price up.  Not a good combo.  We had waters and one ice tea.

Won't be going back. Between the cooks smoking cigarettes out back and the lukewarm, lackluster food I'm done. Add to that a manager that just stands around talking to the bar staff while there are tables that need to be cleared and a food establishment that needs to be CLEANED. Food bits between cushions in the booths that have been there for a very long time, sticky nasty tables, dirty carpet. Clearly, this place has gone downhill. Claimjumper is just down the street and it's clean. The food is MUCH better.

I've been to red robin many times before and always found there service to be slow but this time that was not the case. They were very fast in getting the food to the table but I just didn't feel the quality or quantity of the food matched the cost of it. I used to be able to get bigger sandwiches and more fries. Now I don't get that. I'll stick with Chipotle across the street.

I am always in the mood for a milkshake!  My wife and I stopped here for dinner together. I ordered the Buzz clucks and mac & cheese specifically so my wife could have leftovers to take to work the next day. I wasn't that hungry so I knew I wouldn't be able to finish a full meal. I was disappointed to find that the chicken tenders come smothered in a spicy sauce. I wish that had been specified on the menu. I don't mind spicy but the wife can't handle it which immediately meant whatever food I had left was going to waste. That really bugs me and if I had known that ahead of time i would have ordered something different.  On my quest to sample all of the mac and cheese options in Reno this is definitely at the very bottom of my list now. The cheese was all at the top of the bowl with bare noodles a plenty once you got past the first layer. I ate two bites of this just to give it a shot but it was not good. There was no flavor, no seasoning, and it was all around bland. Another disappointment. My chocolate milkshake was the only part of the meal that I actually enjoyed this evening. The service was good but that didn't make up for the crappy food.

GOOD FOOD, poor service Went on a Sunday Afternoon.  Not overly busy.  Our server was very fast to welcome us and got our fries out right away.  She took our orders and we were good to go.  Then our food came out, had requested a lettuce wrapped burger, not done, and the sauce on the side, also not done.  So it went back.  ordered more fries, had to wait 15 minutes for the refill of the bottomless fries.  Once we got our food it was DELISH!  but having to order and then reorder sides that should have come out with the food, run out of water and soda, and have to wait for our check we were not a fan of.

I'm giving this place ONE star because I'm forced to.  They deserve NO stars.  DISGUSTING, GROSS and I will NEVER return to this place.  Why is every burger place run by airheads??  And 'bottomless fries', would of been nice if our waitress bothered to come check on us and offered those bottomless fires... we saw here only ONCE the entire time!!!  $15 burgers just because they are 'gourmet' is utterly ridiculous!!!  The buns were drier than the Sahara, lettuce was wimpy and not even green -- just a most disgusting experience... my vomit would of tasted better than this junk, ewwwww!!!  This place should CLOSE DOWN and they should open us another 'In-n-Out' burger joint, much cheaper and definitely better tasting!!

Great service. Our server checked on us quife frequently, which was wonderful. She certainly took care of us. The fries were hot, crispy and not to mention BOTTOMLESS! There was so many different gourmet burgers and other entrees to choose from. So many different options. Definitely a place go check out!

My experience here was great. We showed up about an hour before close, so we were expecting the death stare. Luckily we had a super sweet waitress. She was patient taking our order. The menu looked awesome. I would seriously eat anything off their menu. I went with whiskey river bbq burger. It was cooked PERFECTLY. paired with the steak fries, I almost died. Not to mention the fries were bottomless. So it was about ten minutes before close and we didnt feel rushed at all. They treated us very kindly, I will definitely be back for another go around

The menu says no substitutions, but I couldn't find a burger I wanted with the combinations I wanted. I either get onion straws with BBQ sauce or pepper jack cheese or something off. I just wanted regular raw onions!!! But those only come on a simple burger. I didn't want carmalized onions! I didn't want fries! I wanted onion rings! The waitress told me to mix match, but the menu says no substitutions! Contradictory!!!!!! Absolutely Terrible!!!!!! My burger was raw. I am Diabetic and it's Imperative that I eat so I can take a shot. After one bite of a raw burger my appetite was gone and I could eat no more. Thanks incompetent cook! You ruined my whole night! Now I'm at work starving! They should have comped our entire check! No, the server offered me another one. What? Really? I went outside and barfed. Then I sat in the car and waited for my wife and daughter to eat. I work at a convenience store, so I'll be sure to tell ALL my customers NOT to come to your location!!!

The Hostess was less than inviting.  Food was very good ...no complaints re the yummy onion rings, burgers were spot on.  I tend to like my fries a bit more crispy, but these were ok.  The stinker is getting home and noticing I was charged $2.79 ...plus tax! for an iced tea we never ordered nor received.   Now I think I know why the waiter was a bit distracting while waiting for the check/payment.  So.  Watch your receipt better than I did!

Cons Well to start with the greeter was filling helium balloons with the assistance of the female manager as well as huffing the helium. So when he greeted us  and escorted us to our tiny booth, his voice was nice and squeaky.  Both of them thought that they were hilarious. We arrived at 9pm, they did not close until 11pm however they proceeded to starts sweeping the entire restaurant including under our booth and feet the minute we sat down.  The piles of old dirty food were not helping my apatite. The Restaurant smells old and tables and menus are sticky. Pros.  Our waiter was amazing and brought us a fresh burger after the kitchen messed up our order. Seriously, you can find a better restaurant to work at, you got great customer service skills.  Finally Nope, we don't want your loyalty rewards card because we won't be coming back.
Great service. Excellent food. Messy burgers but that only makes them better! It's a busy place and there's no doubt why.

Decent food, similar to chilis but more expensive . This location we had mediocre service. Had to flag down the waitress for drink refills and boxes per usual. Snobby with not an ounce of friendliness in her. Won't be back, I'd rather go to chilis for cheaper food and better service. Also if you're going to advertise bottomless fries train your staff to OFFER THEM and let us know about them. Our server never told us, we overheard ANOTHER waitress telling her customers. Horrible.

Horrible service. Server spilt ranch and rubbed it into the carpet with his foot. We ordered a Cobb salad and they didn't tell us they were out of eggs. Never asked us if they can refill any of our drinks. We had to tell them. One person got sick from their burger. Over all horrible service and they were very rude! I will never eat here again.

Food was good, let's get that out of the way. The service was a bit rough for being a slow night there. We ordered chips and salsa with our drinks. The drinks came but no chips and salsa to be seen. We reminded the waitress and see seemed frustrated . I ordered a cup of clam chowder in addition to my chicken wrap with a fruit side . The clam chowder never came. Once my entree was brought to the table I noticed I was given fries instead of fruit for my side. I again reminded the waitress about my clam chowder and again she seemed frustrated. I'm not sure if the mistakes were on the kitchen or on her but either way forgetting three parts of a meal make for a poor experience .

I used to really look forward to going to Red Robin - as common person as that sounds.   The food used to have great taste and the service used to be awesome.  Wait staff was already very friendly and it was usually a great place to kick back and enjoy good food, decent prices and a nice atmosphere. Things have just gotten worse and worse as the years have gone by.  We are less and less impressed and as of late, a trip to Red Robin equates to lunch at Denny's.  Sure - it'll fill your stomach (sort of) but it won't taste great, you won't be happy during the meal and you'll leave thinking you could have filled an empty gas tank for the price of the two meals you and your spouse just consumed.   Two visits ago my husband and I were being walked to our table by the host.  He tried to seat us at a table.  Having a strong preference for booths and seeing just as many open booths as tables I asked if we could have a booth instead.  You would have thought that I'd asked him to part the Red Sea with the exasperated look on his face as he walked us to a booth and then proceeded to toss the menus on the table and turn around on his heel.  I complained to Management and was not even given the courtesy of acknowledgement that day. This past visit presented a different annoyance.  Horribly sub-bar food.  My husband's burger fell apart on his first bite and my BLTA had no filling.  BLTA = Bacon, lettuce, tomato and avocado.  The sandwich I got included 1 piece of bacon broken up into 3 small pieces. 2 pieces of lettuce, 1 slice of tomato and no avocado.  The Clam Chowder resembled something that a surgeon would suck out during a liposuction procedure.  Did I bother sending it back or complaining?  No - why talk to deaf ears? The magic that was Red Robin is gone.  No longer are the days of happy wait staff, smiling manager who come to the table, great food with very competitive prices and an ambiance that could cheer up even the gloomiest of folks, even if for just 60 minutes. Nothing awful to say and nothing great to say.  Blah....just Blah. BJ's can take my money.  That's pretty much the dining experience I am looking for when I'm just stopping by for a good lunch during a day of shopping.

My daughter and I went yesterday. I ordered Fish and Chips. It was pretty good.  Daughter ordered Cobb Salad. They no longer serve the Half Cobb Salad so she ordered the full size salad. The garlic bread was  burnt, the bacon was a large scoop of cold, very greasy bacon pieces and the cucumber was mushy and spoilt. The waitress acted surprised when I called this mess of a salad to her attention. Daughter ended up eating the chicken off of the salad and I shared my fish. The didn't charge us for the salad, which was actually smaller than the original Half Cobb. Table, menus, condiments and entry door were all disgustingly dirty and sticky. That will be our last trip to Red Robin.

For the price of the burgers you get ripped off pretty painfully. Family of 5 ate here and the bill was $60. That is TWO In N Out Burgers trips for a fantastic experience!  I get it but when you are served burgers that seem at par with or below par to McDonald's, ahem, your goose is cooked. Bottomless fries helped the kids stave off recurring hunger.  I was looking out the window and kicking myself for not at least going to Five Guys Burgers which I could see across the street but that did not prevent my $60 from sailing away.

Huge Red Robin fan, so when I got into Reno I knew exactly where I was placing a to go order. Been to this location before and have never been disappointed. However, things have certainly changed. Here's a quick breakdown:  What I ordered: Red's Tavern Double burger with their famous steak fries  Customer service: no complaints, quickly got in and out with my order  Burger: First off there was no thousand island dressing, which comes standard on this burger. Big disappointment since I didn't get any other condiments with my order. Tasted like a bland, basic burger, nothing special about it. Ended up not finishing it.  Fries: This is the most disappointing part to me because I love Red Robin's seasoned steak fries. Cold and no seasoning. Ok I can't say no seasoning because to be fair there was a pinch of salt on a couple fries. So disappointed. Ate 5 then threw the rest away.  Overall worst Red Robin experience. First time I was left unsatisfied. Place looked pretty slow inside so can't really say the cook was just overwhelmed. :/ Needless to say I ended up having to order room service to calm my still grumbling stomach.

One of the best chicken I ever tasted it tasted so good I wish the red robin mascot was real so I can hunt him down I really love this place I haven't tried the burgers yet but my family says they are really good.

I was a huge fan of the Reno Red Robin, until the menu change this summer. They took the Southwest Salad off the menu, and changed the presentation of all the salads. The portions are much smaller than they were before the changes. The nice romaine lettuce that was piled into a nice entree sized bowl, was replaced with mostly what I call "grass lettuce" on a barely 12x4 plate. A little of that lettuce goes along way. The salad barely covers the plate, and the salad falls off the edges as you are trying to move it around with the fork to eat. It does not fill you up, and for that you pay $10.49! The first time the manager tried to have the kitchen duplicate the old Southwest Salad, as best they could. It was still disappointing. While it was a corporate decision, the manager was very understanding and did what he could to make me happy. There is no value any longer for the $ spent. Until these changes, I ate lunch weekly while in town doing my shopping. I hadn't been in over a month, when my granddaughter and her friend (both 10) wanted to go to Red a Robin yesterday. They have also ruined the kids menu also. The grilled cheese was some small pieces of bread with more crust than soft bread and cheese. The side salad no longer has croutons. A 10 old is not going to eat that lettuce. I had fries to share with her. I got a burger, since I am not happy with the salads. No knife was offered, so I had to wait for another server to bring one. The bun just crumbled apart. The meat and bacon are so thin, you can see through it. The fries yesterday were cold and over seasoned. The 2nd basket is usually very hot and best part of the meal. Not yesterday. The other 10 yr old, had Mac & Cheese. The bowl was only half full, after the waiter made a point of the Mac n Cheese is no longer bottomless. Usually the service is really good, but it was off. Maybe because it was a Sat, and busier than during the week. The birthday sundae for one of the girls was forgotten. We were just ready to leave at that point. I am looking for a restaurant with a decent entree salad! No more Red Robin.

I had some delicious clucks and fries (I can't turn down chicken strips!) a decent strawberry margarita and the freckled Lemmon cake for dessert.  All is pretty delicious and very filling.  The service, however, I feel is always very blah. The servers always seemed rushed and unenthused no matter how busy the restaurant is. The only exceptional service we've had was from lovely Britany. Other than that it's just mediocre.  I'm not a fan of this new computer system on each table. The staff encourages you to order and pay through the computer. I'm sorry, are you the server or am I? I feel like this has much to do with the downhill service. Either way if you come here ask for Britany! She will take care of you!

After 9 days of travel, I saw on my GPS there was a Red Robin in Reno, and I was delighted. Back home in Indianapolis, I eat at RR a few times a month.  I always know I'm able to go in, get seated quickly, be attended upon by friendly wait staff, get delicious, fresh, comfort food, and be on my way.  Upon arrival at the Reno location, I could tell this restaurant was managed completely differently.  It wasn't a busy time (only a few other patrons in the entire restaurant), yet none of the staff greeted us. Finally we got a table, and both of us had to brush lettuce and crumbs off our table and seat. Gross. Our waitress asked us if we were familiar with "the Robin". We said yes, so she just walked away. She didn't tell us about any new specials or burgers, just walked away. After a few minutes she came back to get our order. She wasn't friendly, but wasn't outwardly unpleasant. I'm so used to very cheerful, bubbly staff at RR, so it was off putting.  A few minutes later, another member of the wait staff came over and asked what we'd ordered. We couldn't remember the exact name of the new burger we'd tried, so we had to see a menu. This gentleman explained that our waitress didn't know what we'd ordered. He then walked away. What....?  Then, the wait on the food. Waiting, waiting, waiting. As I said, the restaurant wasn't even busy. We'd began to wonder if our waitress forgot that we'd ordered an appetizer. Then the appetizer came out with our entrees. There wasn't really room on the table for all 3 dishes, so we had to move stuff around.  Everything was cold. The cheese for the pretzel bites was cold and congealed. The burgers had no flavor and the sauce that I'm used to running out the sides, was so little that I couldn't even taste it.   The waitress didn't ask if we wanted more of the "bottomless" fries. We did. Didn't ask if we wanted refills on our drinks. We did.  She did, however, make sure we knew how to pay our check and stayed around for that. Big thanks. $35 for a dirty table, cold food, and no refills.   I'll be moving to Reno in a few months, but I'll never eat at this location again.

Red Robin, you're such a mess... Disclaimer: My 3.5yo son LOVES the place so we frequent it. Normally it is between 3 and 4 stars, but today it was a joke. Someone thought it was a good idea to add the ordering machines to each table. They are a little tablets on a stand with a built-in  credit card reader and a printer. First of all the stupid thing has games on it. So my 3.5 yo tries to play with it. I do not like my family playing with electronic devices during meals. So RR actually encourages the use of devices at the dinner table. Meals are to socialize and have family time. I try to take it away and I am the bad guy. Thanks RR. Also RR is charging for the games so if your kid wins the race to the tablet, you're SOL.  Secondly, the waiters are more confused by these things than the guests.  Lastly, the devices are all mixed up. I am pretty sure we paid for someone else's dinner, but it was close amount, so I didn't want to prolong this painful experience and left.  One more thing; my baby was sitting in a chair that was literally falling apart. I asked for a different one, the waitress acknowledged it and moved on her merry way. The chair was never replaced.  My burger "Burning love" was ok. Spicy but oddly lacking in flavor. My husband's burger the seasonal smoky burger on ciabatta was excellent. That's why the second star.  I think I'll wait a few months before visiting this confused place again.

I went to RR with my roommates and we walked in as an older woman was quietly complaining about something. We weren't sure what she was upset about until she turned to me and said "I hope you're not hungry, we waited a half hour for our food" to which I replied "I'm patient." I watched as this horrible older woman berated a young hostess named Ashley who I would like to commend. Ashley handled this savage of a woman so professionally and grabbed a manager immediately. A thirty minute wait time is hardly unreasonable for a sit down restaurant. The woman should have gone to McDonald's if she wanted faster service. As a college student, I have worked many a job that include dealing with people like the lady mentioned above. I have the upmost respect for workers who deal with such situations with as much grace and professionalism as Ashley did. Your employees are fabulous, RR.

This is the second time we have had really really bad service here. Unfortunately we will not be coming back. Our server was nice, she did a horrendous job but she was  nice. Our food came out after a long time, and our fries were cold. We couldn't find our server bc she was so busy doing side work that my husband finally messed with the tablet on the table to "call server" so we could get some drink refills. She did refill them finally and then disappeared again, we finally just used the tablet to check out because we couldn't locate our server. If my husband has a craving for bottomless fries again we will have to try the Sparks location.

Was not impressed.  The burger was a preprossed frozen burger.  Waitress was slow.   Limited fries & had to wait for waitress. Not again.  Will go across the street to a competitor for a better burger.

I love the food at red robin, that's the only reason I've returned to this location more than once. Yet every time I go back I remember why I dislike this particular location so much. The service is horrendous. I mean 15 minutes just to get a water at the bar on a Wednesday..
Terrible service! All the staff wants you to do is use the tablets at the table, not very personable. It took each time i came to this location at least 40minutes to get a burger thumbs down.

If you're looking for good comfort food, look no further. If you're looking for an enjoyable atmosphere and a clean environment, turn around and leave. Next to having to sit in a dirty booth covered in crumbs and little kid germs, in the corner of the restaurant next to a stack of disgusting chairs and a group of screaming children, the atmosphere was ridiculous. Servers were nice but seemed out of it and those who were supposed to clean seemed like they have never cleaned a thing in their whole life.  Carpet needs to be replaced and I DON'T EVEN want to imagine what the kitchen must look like!  Overall the food was delicious but the place. Was. GROSS!!

The service was terrible and we waited an unnecessary long amount of time for our food. We asked if we could start with fries after ordering our burger since we already waited for a good 20 minutes to order. The fries did not come for another 30-45 minutes. The purpose of asking for the fries first was so that we can get something in our system as we wait for the burgers we ordered. The wait time was just unnecessary and the food was not that great either. Would not recommend this place simply because the service is horrible. So many tables are open, yet they have people waiting at the front. Many of the workers were also doing nothing except walk around in circles as we waited for our refills on drinks and fries.

Kietzke RR is right on my way home from work and I eat our a lot. Today, after working 10 hours, I decided to stop by for a burger and fires. First, let me say the food was very good.  The service was another story.  The person who brought out my order was other than my waitress. He asked me if I needed anything else and like a fool I said no before I realized there was no mustard on the table and he left. I searched nearby table for mustard and there was none. My waitress was on the other side of the room doing something with tableware. I hesitated and then got out of my seat and walked over and asked for mustard. She looked under the counter and there was none and then went on a mission to get a bottle while I returned to my seat. it must have been some mission because it took her close to 5 minutes to bring me back mustard. In the meantime, I could not eat my burger without mustard so I started on the "bottomless fries". Let me state that I was dismayed that not many fries were on my plate but I figured since Red Robin has bottomless fries it would not be long before I received a fresh dose of hot fries. This was wishful thinking since the fries on my plate were not even close to hot, but luke worm.  So here is how it goes, yes my server when she brought out the mustard did refill my coke and that was the last I saw of her except in her corner doing table settings or something. Eventually there was another girl with her and they went to the back. I finished my burger, wanted more fries but minutes went by without seeing my server. The bartender had a couple old men who were being difficult and the other person who brought out my order, never saw him again. I did not get more "bottomless fries" and I paid the bill on the terminal on my computer. I did not get more fries and the waitress got no tip. No one even noticed I left. It is not that the waitress ignored me it was that she did not even care.  It will be a long time before I go back to Red Robin. Next time I see one of their commercials offering bottomless fries I will just shake my head and laugh. If you work ten hours and just want to enjoy a meal and relax when you are STARVING Red Robin Kietzke  is not the place to go.

My husband's fries came out as sweet potato fries he wanted regular fries. They took the extra charge off then brought him regular fries.  I had garlic fries and a salad. I got my first refill of garlic fries BUT they came out as regular fries.  I had to go grab my own fork from the cook station so I could eat my salad.  Had to ask several times for ranch.  Saw the server walking around but was hard to get ahold of.  Took us 40 minutes to get our food. I counted 7 tables that needed to be cleaned. One table had a broom leaning on it for about 12 minutes before anyone touched it.  Last time I came, I was told to sign up for the rewards and that is how we get a military discount. FAIL no discount and yes I signed up and registered correctly. We are on a very tight budget so we tend to go places that offer discounts over places that don't. My lunch choice would have changed and will forever be changed knowing the "discount" is them giving you appreciation discount twice a year.  Bottomless fries are not worth the crappy service, dirty environment, and being lied to about discounts to earn my business.

Why do I keep subjecting myself to this place? Oh yeah, the kid likes it, but even he is over it. They always screw up something and their service has always sucked. I mean it. Every time we go here, something is screwed up. Once.  One, single time, we've had stellar service even if the order was screwed up. You would think that as a burger place, they would, at least, get their burgers right, but sadly, that's not the case. Let's see.  We've had grilled cheese made with the cheese still partially in the plastic.  Thank goodness I noticed because that's when my boy was little.  I've ordered a different cheese on a burger and they haven't done it.  Too much mayo.  Never filling drinks or fries..  Cold, flavorless soup. No refills, dirty silverware, sticky tables with visible grunge on it, rare when burgers are ordered well done. Burned buns, raw buns, buns that were so stale and hard a duck wouldn't eat it, mayo saturated buns.  Burgers with onions when ordered without, can you tell the difference between swiss and cheddar? Raw on inside and burned out or just rare. I won't bore you with all the mess ups.  We don't even go there that often. This time, it took 15 minutes before the server even acknowledged us.  Another 15 to even get our beverages and an order taken.  The napkins provided were dirty and one of the forks was severely bent. We didn't see the server so couldn't ask for replacements. 30 more minutes before food arrived.  I ordered soup as an appetizer and it arrived at the same time as the burger.  I sent it back. Appetizers are before meals.  Asked for more napkins, clean ones, no apology was made.  We never got another fork. The fries were tepid, I can't image what the temperature the soup was. The burger had the wrong bun.  I had to use the stupid table top computer to even get the server back to our table. No one offered to fill our drinks that had been empty since before food arrived.  I ask for the right bun. No apologies again.  It took the server 10 minutes to come tell me that my replacement burger had been ordered.  We've been there almost an hour now. 15 more minutes before the burger arrives.  It's on the right bun, not even toasted, so much mayo that the whole thing is so slick with it, it oozes out and nothing stays in the bun.  The burger is in pieces in the bun, not well done and not with the cheese I ordered.  I'm hungry though so, I move on. Manager brings re-order. She just goes to put it on the table, nothing is said about wrong order, drinks aren't offered to be refilled (I've been sucking ice cubes for a while now).  I told her the order was wrong, the issue with soup, the napkins, the fork, the drinks.  Oh, she finally asks if she can refill the drinks.  Of course, there are still no apologies.  I get the, was the burger our fault too? Yeah lady, it was.  She forgets that we have water and sprite in less than a minute. Never apologizes, just says she's taking burger off the order.  I explain that I only want soup off, it's not my intention to get a free meal, but we've had several because of their screw ups. The manager takes the burger off anyway.  I never see her again despite asking for more sauce.  I've since given up on that too. I take the now soggy, mayo sodden top bun off, scrape as much mayo off the bottom bun as possible and eat what I can.  The lettuce and tomato are drowned at this point, they can't be saved. The pineapple is burned, not grilled.  It's horrible.  Essentially, I eat chunks of medium done burger off a greasy half of bun with a bent fork, sucking ice cubes (I was only half filled) using the limited napkins we were allowed, with no sauce and tepid fries. Sigh.  Server never brings a bill.  I am finally so fed up and we've been there over 2 hours, I just want to go home.  I use the damned table top computer that is meant to replace the need for a server.   I get the idea.  More service, less people, keeps overhead down.  The problem with these table top computers is that if I wanted to go pay triple (or more) than it costs to cook at home, I don't want to serve myself.  I can order pizza to be delivered from my home computer. Anyway, I fold and pay with the stupid thing.  Other than walking out, there's no other choice.  The tip.  Really nothing.  Why? I get that they live on tips, I've done it.  I usually tip when it's the kitchen's fault, but for wrong orders, poor service and having to serve myself, I think not. Hell, if they've even tossed me a single apology for their screw ups, I probably would have tipped, but nope.  Really, save yourself the trouble and go elsewhere.  Bottomless fries aren't worth it anymore.

Saturday 4/16/16, 2 people, dinner 6pm Ambiance: 3 stars Food: 5 stars Service: 5 stars For what it is, I always seem to have a good meal. As an UBER picky eater, I always dread going into a place like this and being nitpicky about my order. I mean...do I really expect that level of service for a $12 burger?!? I have to say though, that Seth was amazing! He was patient; answered all my questions and in the end, I got exactly what I wanted! I couldn't be more pleased with my 'cheat day'! Everything was great, but I have to say, you need yo try the Chipotle sauce, if you like a kick! I jad some left & am taking it home for a sandwich for tomorrow!

Came here after a day of strolling downtown Reno with Yelp friends.  They stayed in downtown while we headed home.  I know I should have taken in the eateries downtown but the wife needed some food after our downtown bar and eatery tour.  We were seated promptly and orders were taken.  She had a bbq burger and I chose the standard cheddar burger. We both asked for medium rare and we both got well done.  They have a computer screen you can order food, pay your check and play games while you wait for your order.  When I went to pay, I noticed a 1.99 entertainment fee on my bill.  I inquired as to what the entertainment fee was about and the waitress stated it was for playing the trivia games on the screen.  I informed her that I must have not noticed the charge for playing the games when I went into the trivia app.  She said it does not inform you about the charge in advance, only upon paying the bill.  Now, most unsuspecting patrons would just pay the bill and it would go unnoticed......shame on Red Robin for not telling you in advance.

I'm not sure I like Red Robin anymore they took out arcade and try to make it more sophisticated with shutters and lighting. Yet the seating is kind of uncomfortable with the booths that fit two people lets just squish everyone together make it Super uncomfortable! I would work on making more comfortable that stylish.

The food wasn't bad, but the floors are disgusting. Nothing like feeling like you stepped in gum only to realize the floors are literally that sticky. Hey Red Robin, you're a huge corporation, renovation is loooooonnng overdue!

When my family dines out, it's usually sushi, buffet or sometime fancy. Rarely do we say, hey let's go do a sit down burger joint. Usually when we want burgers, we go to In and Out. But once in a while we do come here. The burgers are awesome and never had a bad one. Always cooked perfectly to order. Unlimited fries is... well unlimited. This time around we brought our baby daughter and the staff was very friendly and helpful to accommodate us. We will definitely be back again. There are still too many burgers we haven't tried.

I try to like Red Robin. And sometimes I do but... Overall? It's just a miss for me. Tonight's dinner: me and my two kids. They each had a cheeseburger. They were decent, nothing special. I don't like their steak fries but the kids do, so cool. I had the Whiskey River chicken salad. That was a big letdown. The portion was not very big, of either salad or chicken. The chicken was dry. The BBQ sauce was decent, it saved the chicken. The menu said it came with garlic toast- it actually came with two small, thin, bland, super crisp (I would say brittle) crostini. I only ate about half of it before I got bored. I also got sweet potato fries which were good but cold, and dipped them in the spicy ketchup which was the highlight of the meal. The highlight of the meal was ketchup. So, yeah. Not great. I've had things there I liked much better. The DGB burger, for instance. That's decent. And I remember liking their fish and chips a billion years ago, but that's been a while. They have some alcoholic shakes and stuff that look good but I was not in the mood tonight.  Now... The service is a little bit of a problem. It wasn't overly quick for us but not terrible either. But I did notice that the table beside us, who actually got there before us, got basically ignored. They got their drinks and the server never came back to their table. She walked by a lot of times. They tried to signal her but she never noticed. Finally when she delivered our food to our table and still didn't go back to them, they stood up and walked out. And it took about 15 minutes for her to notice they'd gone. It was really weird.

The food was just okay. What really made me upset is what happened after we ate our so so meal. We paid our bill at the table using their tablet. Two days later someone was in Las Vegas having the time of their lives with our hard earned money.

I was enjoying my burger to go,( that was supposed to have extra cheese, there was barley any to say that there was a regular amount) when I bite into some thing hard. It was a half of a plastic bread bag tie. Very disappointed.

We have been here at least 3 or 4 times now. Until this last visit, I would have rated it 3 stars: decent, but not great. On this recent visit, things were a bit worse. We waited for approximately 70 minutes before we were served our dinner! While we did have a party of 10, waiting this long was unacceptable. Also, you would think that any table waiting this long would be visited fairly regularly by the server; we were only visited twice during this wait (after our order was taken). For one of those rounds we had to flag down a server to get table items (drink sweeteners, silverware). When the food finally arrived, some of it was cold. Also, even though the correct dishes/orders were delivered to each of us, some of them were incomplete. For example, a Cobb Salad was delivered with no egg and no bacon, even though it was ordered with those items. We would have sent it back, but we were so hungry after the long wait, we didn't bother. When the server checked on us after our order was delivered, we asked for more fries ("bottomless fries" you know). They never brought them. We had to flag him down and ask again. 5-10 minutes later they finally arrived. Overall, the entire dinner took at least 2.5 hours! This was dinner only; we weren't drinking or doing anything else at the restaurant. I can only imagine they were having major problems in the kitchen, but who knows. I never saw a manager anywhere around the restaurant. As a final note, the food itself tasted decent-to-good overall. I would rate the quality of the food 3-4 stars. Given the downturn in our experience, I don't think we'll be going back.

Very impressed, I go here all the time and I rarely have any issues. Recently I went there and the service was very slow and the server was kind of rude. I called and talked to the manager Scott who made sure our next visit was wonderful and it really was our waiter (Cody) was great and I ate the most amazing burger I have ever had in my life!!!!
We were helped by Isaac Hernandez, he went above and beyond to help with my food allergy! Great service!!

You have lost my business and I never even made it to being seated. Open tables in the bar.  Waited 15 mins and then they started seating people that arrived after I did - hostess was clueless as to why.   Called the manager as I was driving out of the parking lot to let her know she needs to get a handle on why customers are waiting when there are open tables and to let her know her customers are walking out the door.   Manager was at a loss to any explanation so that really explains why this place is so disorganized.

I came here today and was surprised to see it newly renovated. The host promptly attended my friends and I when we arrived. All the employees looked like they were having fun, which uplifted my spirit. As I was looking through the plethora of food and beverage options, I couldn't decide what I wanted. I asked the server what she liked, and I ended up ordering the tavern Q burger. Bonus points for bottomless steak fries! Now I've been to many burger joints and I must say that I was pleasantly satisfied with what I got. The burger wasn't that big, but the seasoning was spot on along with the melted cheese. As for drinks, I got a red sangria that was delicious - not watered down or filled with pure alcohol. Overall a great mixture. I'm obligated to mention that the desserts are some of the best. They have chocolate sticks and doughnut rings that are a perfect ending to a burger meal! My friends and I were happy with our food and the service was fantastic. I recommend anyone looking for good burgers to try out Red Robin.
I came here a couple days ago and it was amazing.  The sweet potato fries were great and they were bottomless. It couldn't get better than that.

Terrible service. Sat for over an hour and the server forgot to put our order in, even after walking by us on multiple occasions and not checking on us once. I spoke with the manager and she said she was sorry. Poor customer service not even worth tasting the food. Went across the street to Five Guys.

I usually love Red Robin but today at this location, I was not impressed. We ordered the artichoke spinach dip which was $7 + tax and came on this dinky little dish. The dip wasn't even enough for the small portion of chips that came with it. We were then approached by 3 different people after our meal to "check on us". We were taking our time and talking, not over extending our visit and there wasn't a line or wait so why rush is out. I finally said "we get it, we are leaving." I won't be returning to this location.

Recently remodeled, portions are now a third of the old size while prices remain the same. Side salad is better, but also 4 dollars for a mediocre salad, had to ask to get refills, food was crammed into a small basket. I paid 14 dollars for two small pieces of cod, five shrimp, and roughly ten clam strips. Also, suspiciously undercooked clams, cod was saturated due to being crammed into an 8" basket.  While I get that it is red robin, and not exactly fine dining, haha, this wasn't exceptable, I've been here 4-5 times before, and was given what I expected. Tables were sticky, felt king of gross eating there, I did not informthe manager, seemed kind of pointless the hostess was pleasant though. I'll try again in 6 months to a year, maybe it's due to management?

Went here to eat lunch before heading back to sac and I was unable to use my free birthday burger from their rewards program cause I got one of those specialty burgers. I told the person who was serving us I can pay for the difference but he said I  can't doo that but I can get a chili cheese burger. I'm sorry I did not want a chili cheese burger and did not want to waste the  food that was already in front of me. I'm sorry he didn't even try to see what he can do. Horrible customer service!

Went to Red Robin and walked in stood in the lobby waiting for someone to come greet us and seat us- but that NEVER occurred. We did however get to listen to people come up and complain about how they have been waiting for over thirty minutes and haven't received any food. Still stood waiting and watched as we were ignored by not one or two but THREE employees. Walked out having never been acknowledged. I would say worst service ever but never received any.

I wish the reviews had a choice lower than one star. Went with my daughter for a fun lunch and the food and service was terrible. I should have left when the hostess told us there was a 15 minute wait when tables were open. When we were seated had another long wait to get drinks, which were NEVER refilled even after asking. I ordered the beef dip and the bread was old and the au juice was cold. Of course waitress was never seen again to even tell her. My daughter enjoyed her burger which was over $10, but her fries were served cold. We will not be back.

Worst service I have ever had in a Red Robin.  20 min had passed before the manager walked by and asked if everything was ok. I told him we haven't even seen our food server and had been trying to call for assistance with the table kiosk , but we ready to order. Manager was kind enough to take our order. Few min later drinks were brought to us by the busboy.  Shortly after, a waitress walked by and said "your order is in" and dropped off utensils. When our food arrived it was brought to us by our busboy who checked and asked if everything was ok. I asked for a refill of milk for my son. Waitress walked by and dropped off another drink for me but not my son.  After about 10 Mins. Waitress asked if we were done and I told her I was waiting for a glass of milk so my could eat.  When we finally finished eating she asked if I was ready to pay and pushed the table kiosk toward me.
