If she had stopped by earlier she would have know it wasn't working well because I had attempted to use it to call for service. Poor excuse for service.  The place was busy ,but there were still empty seats around me.  I will not be going back to this Red Robin ever and will just encourage everyone to visit 5 Guys Burger and Fries across the street.

I called in during lunch time for an order to go and was placed on hold for a little while(it was lunchtime rush, I understand) and ended up having to call back in to place my order. Once I placed it, I realized I made a mistake so I called to change it and was once again placed on hold so I decided to just go down there...When I got there, the person in charge of to-go orders immediately apologized for not getting to my phone call, and gave me the extra item I was ordering for free! He told me about the rewards program and had me sign up for it while I was waiting for the item to be made(only took about 5 minutes) and before I left, he gave me a freckled lemonade which happens to be one of my favorite things on the menu. I was only slightly ticked off about them not being able to take my phone call to change the order, but the fact that they went above and beyond to fix it definitely earned them 5 stars!

Love this place.  The burgers are always yummy.  What I like best about this place is I can order my burger in a lettuce wrap instead of a bun.  I come here at least once a month and never had a bad experience.

This was the first time we ate at Red Robin. The wait for our food was extremely long it appears that maybe they were under staffed. Corey our waiter was awesome and kept us inform on our food. Their black and blue burger was awesome on a ciabatta bread. The burger was cooked to my liking and the burger was topped with blue cheese, muahrooms, carmelized onions and their bottomless fries. Besides the long wait on our food they did have awesome burgers
We eat there every 3 or 4 months. My husband goes crazy for the mushroom burger and I love the salads. Very yummy, and worth the money.

Well spent 40 min waiting for our food. The manager should have been more on the ball as several tables were complaining about the service.  While the manager did come by to say they were sorry and took some $$ off or bill, I think they need to take a hard look at their kitchen staff as this hurts their bottom-line.   We did give our waitress a decent tip as it was not her fault as it would have hurt her income as well.  So the food was okay. But if you plan on taking up residency at the Red Robbin in Reno this is the place for you.

Another yummy meal at red robin. They just remodeled, which they really needed! It looks great and the food is the same. Can't beat the bottomless fries and freckled lemonade!!!!!! Along as you don't order an appetizer then you can pretty much eat 2/$25 which now days isn't too bad.

My family went to Red Robin last night and didn't have long to wait! Crystal our very pregnant waitress was great and caught that I had the wrong meal!! It was good food, but the chocolate pie was huge and good, but took to long to TRY to eat it as it was frozen! I was shocked on the cost of our meal!! Also I won't get well done hamburger again, too well cooked! Not sure IF I will come back!! Crystal would be the reason!

I had gone in for a birthday burger and showed up with my brother. The burger and an appetizer we had ordered. My brother and I told the server we were intending to split it and when the burger was brought it it was already cut in half and we each had our separate plate and fries. Very nice not to have to do that ourselves. Shows the staff goes the extra mile to make sure the customer is comfortable. Definitely appreaciated and will be back for the great service recieved that day.
Beer glass had food floating in it, they also cramped us in a tiny little table. Never coming back

This was our first visit to this location. For a Saturday night, the wait time wasn't too bad as we only waited about 15 minutes. We had a waiter at our table within a minute of us sitting down and  drinks were served shortly afterwards. From the time our order was taken; it did take quite a while for us to be served our food but it was hot and it was worth the wait. Overall, this was a great first experience and a shout out to our waiter 'Raul' for such great service. Thanks!

We came in the middle of the afternoon on Saturday, not much people are waiting, but we were ask to wait for 10 minutes. 15 minutes later the hostess tried to seat us on a table not even big enough to get drinks and appetizer.  We ask for a bigger table or a booth instead, the hostess claim there are several bigger tables but they had not been cleaned, so we waited for another 5 minutes for a little clean table.  Our server came swiftly to ask us of our drink orders and then our meal orders, brought in the chicken wings first then the strawberry shake, I have notice the shake glass was half the size they normally bring in but the server says it's the same amount as the original glass they normally serve it to, the server says their shake glasses were not washed, I look around and the restaurant is barely full of people. So many excuses. The good part out of all this is our food at least, tasty burger and chicken sandwich, the Yukon potatoes and the chicken wings are good as well.  I guess can't really ask for more, it's just like eating in any fast food joint only a little bit glorified.

45 minute wait for our meal. They forgot to put guacamole on our bacon guacamole burger then charged us an additional $1.25 for the guacamole that should have been on the burger in the first place. Won't be back.

I came with a group of 6 around 7:30. There was definately a long line but the wait was only a half an hour. We walked in straight to a table that we requested. The scene is loud and packed but very family oriented. We had a server named Amanda. She is one of the reasons why are dinner was so comfortable.   I ordered a guacamole burger, but with a 1/2 lbs and a side of two sunny side eggs and unlimited sweet potato fries. (It's unlimited bottomless fries) my burger was a hit. If I wasn't with my younger cousins I would have ordered a blue moon  to wash it down cause it Goes perfectly.   Overall it was great. Recommend it to large parties because it is so family oriented.       By the way, if you happen to get Amanda: she's truly amazing. Be sure to tip her.

The food was awesome and our waiter Bryce was outstanding! Very caring and sweet. Even when the order came out wrong he fixed it right away with a great smile. It's so refreshing to have someone with such a positive attitude helping us. Very enjoyable trip.

The food here is pretty good but they fill balloons all day with the loudest air compressor ever made. So it sounds like a leaf blower constantly going off inside 10 feet from you. Dont cone here if you want to talk to anyone or have a nice meal.

I have to say the last 3 times we  came here they have always put us in the back by windows and it is like an ice box . We were seated asked the waitress to fix it and she said the manager would never did then another party was sat by us and complained about the same thing. You really need to fix this or dont seat anyone there. We love the food but if they try to put us back there again will walk out. The food is 5 star amd service just the situation is not at all.

I took a large group to the Red Robin in Reno . I had make. Arrangements for 30 people and call to change to 35 and then again on Monday to say we would be  40 people coming . They only gave us one waitress for cocktails and dinner . Audrey did a excellent job with very little help . We had even ask for single tickets  she kept it all straight . Thank you  Audrey for making  the evening a success.

Worst curbside service.  I stopped in to get a salad and was told it would take 12 minutes.  It is now going on a half hour.  I won't be coming back to this location.  Sparks restaurant has much better service.

My family (6) came here because we noticed the long drive-thru line for In-N-Out.  We decided we would rather spend time in a restaurant instead.  BIG MISTAKE!  30-40 min of waiting in the lobby for our table to be ready. After we were seated, an additional 30-40 minutes for our food to be ready.  From what we heard, they were short on staff and/or someone in the kitchen quit.  The restaurant and staff were very disorganized..  This amount of time waisted was not worth the burger.  LESSON LEARNED, NEVER AGAIN.

Great 5th Birthday for my granddaughter. Service was perfect, attentive, helpful, and timely.  Burgers were cooked just right, from the salmon burger to the specialty burgers. Fries, plank and sweet potato, were hot and plentiful with enough dipping ranch dressing for all concerned. Sangria was weak and I wouldn't recommend it, not enough fruit mixed in and over powered by the red wine. Parking was available and restaurant was clean. A minor lighting issues was quickly corrected by helpful staff member. Birthday girl even got a song and a sundae. We all wore our princess crowns, too!

Went to lunch today for my birthday with my daughter.  Did not like the food.  I had a cheeseburger and fries.  The burger was just barely OK and on my plate I was served a little extra.  There were about 5 large crusty old macaroni noodles.  Instantly grossed me out and made me wonder about how sloppy and yucky the kitchen might be. (You know the ole what you can't see if what you can see doesn't look very good?) The plate passed the cooks inspection and then the waiters too.  Oh yea and the side of thousand island I got for my fries, looked like it had cottage cheese in it.  Big hunks of mayo that weren't blended in. Manager came over to ask about my food so I told her.  She said she would look at the dressing.  Now I know why I haven't been there in at least 6 or 7 years.  Maybe I'll forget in another 6 or 7???

I went in for a late lunch, got great service at the bar. I ordered a Smokey Jack Tavern Burger with avocado, fried pickles and a coke. Everything tasted great! And the right amount of service. Everything was clean including the bathroom.

Devoured the Ghost Burger and fries with campfire sauce! Always a good idea for Red Robin! We were seated quickly and asked if we wanted drinks to start, always a sign of good things to follow (IMHO). Service was very good, server had a great attitude, dining area was well lit and clean.

I've frequented this Red Robin location quite a few times.   The burgers and endless fries are KILLER!   Love the Shroom Burger!   And the service is pretty top notch.   But.....their bathrooms and restaurant are FILTHY!    The tables are sticky, the floors are sticky and have gross hair and debris stuck all around the edges of the molding.   The bathrooms are totally disgusting.   There is human hair, urine and dirty toilet seats.   Every time I go there, I've been unable to use the restroom.   In my opinion this is a management issue, managers should require employees to clean the facility top to bottom to maintain a clean, sanitary place where folks can eat, and if necessary use the restroom.   That's my only complaint, good food, filthy establishment.

I got the Red Robin Royal burger and it wasn't as good time as good as it was the first time that I got it. The first time I got it it was a 5-star burger for sure and it was probably the most delicious hamburger I've ever had lately the last couple times I've tried it the egg wasn't cooked as well and it turned into a total mess it wasn't delicious like I would have hoped.   The servers are okay, nothing special but a couple of them making extra effort to go above and beyond with the bottomless fries which are some of my favorite.  Whenever I go in during lunch time they never seem to be very busy. It seems a little bit fresher than fast food by it's not a very big step up from fast food other than the fries their fries are delicious! Parking at this location is excellent which makes it easy!

we haven't been to red robin for years so decided to try it again..it was dirty in there, the food was ok but we wont be returning. all the torani syrup bottles were plastered with finger prints and very filthy. the atmosphere was weird and did not feel comfortable..rather go to five guys then red robin..

Food is always amazing.  We eat here about once a month. Not once have we had a good server. Its hard to get refills on drinks and frys.  If we are going with a big party we will go to the sparks location as their server's are excellent.  Maybe have sparks train the servers at this location..?

Bad service server Isic, the gentlemen with glasses , is bad server , who has there table waits 15 minutes for fries especially if you want them before your meal,  Horrible service horrible food , mcdonals an other fast food chains do better then Red Robin  This place needs to be shut down to

I really wish we had Red Robin Restaurants in Hawaii. I was by myself and sat at the bar. The bartender was super accomodating and very engaging. I ordered a bonsai burger, which never disappoints. It was really good, but I could only eat half as they are so filling. Already looking forward to my next trip to the mainland so I can have another one!

We stopped in the restaurant because of one of their BOGO offers. It was busy, noisy and there was a wait for a seat except for the bar top which we chose. The food and service from the bartender was good considering the crowd, but it appears to me that Red Robin does not want the servers to waste time serving customers. After we took our seats, when the bartender had time to get to us, the first thing she did was put a Ziosk terminal in front of us, as if we were supposed to use it instead of ordering from the bartender. I let her know that when we go out to eat, we want a good meal, and good service, not another touchscreen to deal with. I explained that we did try the Ziosk terminals when Red Robin first installed them but they were always had problems, particularly not taking our Royalty card and crashing, and are more aggravation than they are worth. They still are. When we tried to check out using the terminal per the Bartender's request, bit it wouldn't accept our Royalty card and crashed. We asked the bartender to check us out manually, which led to the manager, who appeared highly annoyed, coming by. There was no apology for the terminal crashing or the inconvenience and when I expressed my displeasure with the continued problems with the Ziosk terminals he informed us that everybody uses them. I let him know that based of the continued bad experience with the terminals, we don't like them, would prefer not to use them and that we would appreciate it if they wouldn't make the servers drop them in front of us when we dined. I also reiterated that they have frequently crashed when we have tried to use them and we prefer to have a live server taking care of us. He informed us that the terminals were there to stay and they are expecting customers to use them. I informed him that if they expect us to use them, particularly with their crashing problems, we can always find another restaurant. He informed us that it was corporate policy. Overall, it is readily apparent to me that the Manager doesn't give a ##@# if we enjoy our visit or not.

Our waitress Christine wasn't The best... she let our drinks become empty... we hardly saw her but the Chicken whiskey burger, the original whiskey burger, onion rings, and fries were delicious. It's a good burger fix!

We were going to eat at Five Guys but they were closed due to weather.  Red Robin was right there and we hadn't been there in a long time.  They were not very busy.  We were seated greeted by our server right away.  The food took a long time.  The server came by twice to apologize and say our order would be right up.  Finally she and another server bring trays out but the server realizes that one of her tables left without  paying. So both trays of food are set on two tables while she goes to chase them down in the parking lot.  The other server just walks away.  So i served our food to our family.  The manager sees this and comes to "help" me finish and explains that she had to go after them.  Seriously?  Then the server comes to say that if someone skips, then they get fired.  Seriously?  So company policy puts you in a position of leaving my food unserved and on another table so you can chase people down.  The food was mediocre at best, not piping hot and pricey for the quality.  We will never go back.

So I am a Buffalo Bills fan [Insert joke about being a Bills fan] and I was wearing my bright blue Bills shirt. My girlfriend and I go to sit at the bar and a women from across the bar, who is wearing a Patriot's shirt, says to me "Did you lose a bet? Did someone force you to wear that shirt?" I didn't know what to say so I kinda just laughed and shrugged it off. While this is happening, the bartender, who is turned around, hears what is going on and jumps in to save me. When he turns around, I suddenly realize he is decked out in Buffalo Bills gear and says to me "don't worry about her, she is just mad that the Pats are behind us in the division."   At this point, I really didn't care what the food tasted like because this made my whole experience. The food and beer was good though and we even ordered a dessert. We both ordered burgers and had our fair share of bottomless fries. The desert we ordered, was HUGE and we couldn't finish it all. I will definitely be back on a Sunday afternoon wearing my Bills gear loud and proud.

My favorite burger joint in Portland.  Great sandwiches AND a free birthday burger every year.  I usually go to the one in Pensacola at Córdoba Mall or the one by Lloyd's Center in Portland, Oregon.  A little noisy but consistently good food and service.
Red Robin removed the Boca Burger from their menu in order "to save a buck". As long as they remain "Boca Burger free", they will be dead to me. Dead to me! DEEEAAAAD TOOOO MEEEEEE!
Drinks are on point. Burgers definitely on point. Bottomless fries on point. Red Robin is on point. Big burgers. You need 2 hands for them.

Received good service from Isaac. He made an ok experience at first much better towards the end. If you order "bottomless" fries ask them to serve you two servings cuz they will only give you like 6 fries or just as soon as you get your order make sure you pull them aside and tell them to start a new one because it take some time for them to be made. Just a tip.

Bottomless Steak Fries!! they had me at bottomless fries :) I have been here a handfull of times, and always enjoy the food. reasonable prices, especially their $6.99 burgers. Recently I saw on their download menu that they use cage-free/hormone-free chicken breasts from family owned farms! hurray for them on keeping the local farmers in business. Overall a great place to come for a family meal, or even a birthday dinner. their online site makes ordering food to go super simple.

Red Robin, just saying, if I want my food shoved into a little basket, I'll go to a fast food joint. No wonder they have all you can eat fries, they only give you about 10 to start with ( that's probably all they can fit into that tiny basket) and the fries were so under cooked, who would ask for more?? Not me for sure.

Went here the other night with my boyfriend because a gourmet burger sounded MOUTH WATERING. It's the first time I've been to this location and I hadn't been to Red Robin in awhile.  Regardless, the bottomless fries were calling my name. We were promptly seated in the bar and our waiter came to greet us. That's where things started to get a little weird. He greeted me by "dude", told us not to let him forget the silverware and to stab him if he did (which at first I thought was my kind of humor), and asked us for drinks. After I denied alcoholic beverages he asked me if I had had too much the night before. Ugh!!!  I looked over the menu and found a spicy, jalepeno topped burger with a corn bread Kaiser roll, sounded delicious. When I said that's what I was leaning towards the waiter he said he got plastered by jalepeno margaritas and downed a burger and it was delicious. Okay....... then he went to refill my water and never brought it back. My boyfriend noted he set it down on the bar, got confused and was kind of rude when he asked if we could have a new one.  My boyfriend ordered a double burger, he got a single patty. The waiter wasn't attentive so he just ate it, even though he tried to bring it up multiple times. The waiter was just sitting with another table talking. A manager came over to apologize and after all of this.... the worst part.  The waiter, who didn't seem to be all there and kind of suspicious, came over and said AND I QUOTE "ya I know things were wrong with your burger but there's a survey on your bill, just go ahead and rate me all 10/10s" I cannot tell you how uncomfortable I felt the whole night and that was just the cherry on top.  I do want to note that the food was delicious. One of the best burgers I've had. Just horrible experience overall.

I have eaten at Red Robin so many times and tonight the food was totally disappointing. I had the ruby river bbq chicken and I had it rapped in lettuce and I told them no cheese so when they brought me my food it had cheese on it the lettuce was so limp that I couldn't even cut it with my knife and the chicken was so dry that I couldn't even eat it.. so I'm very disappointed and I don't think I'll ever go back.
Nationwide chain. And know how to treat people and their food is excellent. The staff is motivated and the facility is always very clean

Had a great experience at Red Robbins in Reno this afternoon. The service was excellent. The server was attentive without being overbearing and timely with every aspect. The food was served hot, and had great flavor. I had a Bleu Cheese and mushroom burger with onion rings and the spice ketchup dipping sauce. The sauce was plentiful and so good I also put it on my burger.  We had an opportunity to speak with the GM who was very good. Until this visit Red Robbin was not high on my list of places to eat, now it has moved up a number of notches.

We visited on 12/29/17 with a large group.  They did a great job of keeping us happy.  They served us drinks and advanced us some fries on out order.  When serving the group a burger got jostled to the floor  (so sad) but they made a new one super quick and delivered it out. Thanks for the tasty food, good service and the efficient large party management.

Ben Oates Hired me on as a busser and then I show up for orientation, Everything's cool then after orientation they tried to switch me to a host a Lower paying mind numbing job and then tried to give me some dumb excuse about how they don't have bussers anymore , Agm can't remember his name tried to say the Servers and Hosts were gonna clean the tables themselves , The Managers at Red Robin will treat you like your dumb not a good place to work for , Shit I won't even eat there anymore , Your better off going to Olive Garden, Red Lobster Etc If your looking for work

Red Robin has gone the way of the  corporates. Offer a fancier plating with less food, charge more, push drinks and appetizers, and follow the corporate seating chart and that formula will fix everything.  Not my favorite cookie cutter philosophy.  The seating is like police profiling. The bottomless fries are funny to me. They serve a third of what they used to. They will bring you another 1/3 of a serving if you happen to catch your server before they clear your table.  Somehow the perceived value of getting 2/3's of what they used to serve is a benefit?  Smaller burgers too. Because Red Robin made its name on tasty and innovative burgers that filled the plate and your belly at the same time, I think it is a shame. I am not saying the food is bad. This location has good servers, cooks, and managers. I am just not a fan of the "Chili's" style changes.
